title: Gemini CLI Settings
description: Schema for the Gemini CLI settings.json file, managing configuration across user, workspace, and system scopes.

preferredEditor.description: The preferred editor to open files in.

enablePromptCompletion.description: Enable AI-powered prompt completion suggestions while typing.

retryFetchErrors.description: Retry on "exception TypeError: fetch failed sending request" errors.

debugKeystrokeLogging.description: Enable debug logging of keystrokes to the console.

maxAge.description: Maximum age of sessions to keep (e.g., "30d", "7d", "24h", "1w")

maxCount.description: Alternative: Maximum number of sessions to keep (most recent)

minRetention.description: Minimum retention period (safety limit, defaults to "1d")

format.description: The format of the CLI output.

theme.description: The color theme for the UI. See the CLI themes guide for available options.

showStatusInTitle.description: Show Gemini CLI status and thoughts in the terminal window title

hideTips.description: Hide helpful tips in the UI

hideContextSummary.description: Hide the context summary (GEMINI.md, MCP servers) above the input.

hideCWD.description: Hide the current working directory path in the footer.

hideSandboxStatus.description: Hide the sandbox status indicator in the footer.

hideModelInfo.description: Hide the model name and context usage in the footer.

hideContextPercentage.description: Hides the context window remaining percentage.

hideFooter.description: Hide the footer from the UI

showMemoryUsage.description: Display memory usage information in the UI

showLineNumbers.description: Show line numbers in the chat.

showCitations.description: Show citations for generated text in the chat.

useFullWidth.description: Use the entire width of the terminal for output.

useAlternateBuffer.description: Use an alternate screen buffer for the UI, preserving shell history.

customWittyPhrases.description: Custom witty phrases to display during loading. When provided, the CLI cycles through these instead of the defaults.

screenReader.description: Render output in plain-text to be more screen reader accessible

hasSeenNudge.description: Whether the user has seen the IDE integration nudge.

model.description: Settings related to the generative model.

name.description: The Gemini model to use for conversations.

maxSessionTurns.description: Maximum number of user/model/tool turns to keep in a session. -1 means unlimited.

summarizeToolOutput.description: Enables or disables summarization of tool output. Configure per-tool token budgets (for example {"run_shell_command": {"tokenBudget": 2000}}). Currently only the run_shell_command tool supports summarization.

compressionThreshold.description: The fraction of context usage at which to trigger context compression (e.g. 0.2, 0.3).

aliases.description: Named presets for model configs. Can be used in place of a model name and can inherit from other aliases using an `extends` property.

overrides.description: Apply specific configuration overrides based on matches, with a primary key of model (or alias). The most specific match will be used.

context.description: Settings for managing context provided to the model.

fileName.description: The name of the context file or files to load into memory. Accepts either a single string or an array of strings.

importFormat.description: The format to use when importing memory.

discoveryMaxDirs.description: Maximum number of directories to search for memory.

includeDirectories.description: Additional directories to include in the workspace context. Missing directories will be skipped with a warning.

loadMemoryFromIncludeDirectories.description: Controls how /memory refresh loads GEMINI.md files. When true, include directories are scanned; when false, only the current directory is used.

enableRecursiveFileSearch.description: Enable recursive file search functionality when completing @ references in the prompt.

disableFuzzySearch.description: Disable fuzzy search when searching for files.

tools.description: Settings for built-in and custom tools.

sandbox.description: Sandbox execution environment. Set to a boolean to enable or disable the sandbox, or provide a string path to a sandbox profile.

enableInteractiveShell.description: Use node-pty for an interactive shell experience. Fallback to child_process still applies.

pager.description: The pager command to use for shell output. Defaults to `cat`.

autoAccept.description: Automatically accept and execute tool calls that are considered safe (e.g., read-only operations).

core.description: Restrict the set of built-in tools with an allowlist. Match semantics mirror tools.allowed; see the built-in tools documentation for available names.

allowed.description: Tool names that bypass the confirmation dialog. Useful for trusted commands (for example ["run_shell_command(git)", "run_shell_command(npm test)"]). See shell tool command restrictions for matching details.

exclude.description: Tool names to exclude from discovery.

discoveryCommand.description: Command to run for tool discovery.

callCommand.description: Defines a custom shell command for invoking discovered tools. The command must take the tool name as the first argument, read JSON arguments from stdin, and emit JSON results on stdout.

useRipgrep.description: Use ripgrep for file content search instead of the fallback implementation. Provides faster search performance.

enableToolOutputTruncation.description: Enable truncation of large tool outputs.

truncateToolOutputThreshold.description: Truncate tool output if it is larger than this many characters. Set to -1 to disable.

truncateToolOutputLines.description: The number of lines to keep when truncating tool output.

enableMessageBusIntegration.description: Enable policy-based tool confirmation via message bus integration. When enabled, tools automatically respect policy engine decisions (ALLOW/DENY/ASK_USER) without requiring individual tool implementations.

enableHooks.description: Enable the hooks system for intercepting and customizing Gemini CLI behavior. When enabled, hooks configured in settings will execute at appropriate lifecycle events (BeforeTool, AfterTool, BeforeModel, etc.). Requires MessageBus integration.

mcp.description: Settings for Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers.

serverCommand.description: Command to start an MCP server.

allowed.description: A list of MCP servers to allow.

excluded.description: A list of MCP servers to exclude.

useSmartEdit.description: Enable the smart-edit tool instead of the replace tool.

disableYoloMode.description: Disable YOLO mode, even if enabled by a flag.

enabled.description: Setting to track whether Folder trust is enabled.

enforcedType.description: The required auth type. If this does not match the selected auth type, the user will be prompted to re-authenticate.

useExternal.description: Whether to use an external authentication flow.

excludedEnvVars.description: Environment variables to exclude from project context.

extensionReloading.description: Enables extension loading/unloading within the CLI session.

useModelRouter.description: Enable model routing to route requests to the best model based on complexity.

maxNumTurns.description: Maximum number of turns for the Codebase Investigator agent.

maxTimeMinutes.description: Maximum time for the Codebase Investigator agent (in minutes).

thinkingBudget.description: The thinking budget for the Codebase Investigator agent.

model.description: The model to use for the Codebase Investigator agent.

workspacesWithMigrationNudge.description: List of workspaces for which the migration nudge has been shown.

hooks.description: Hook configurations for intercepting and customizing agent behavior.

MCPServerConfig.description: Definition of a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server configuration.

args.description: Command-line arguments for the stdio transport command.

env.description: Environment variables to set for the server process.

cwd.description: Working directory for the server process.

headers.description: Additional HTTP headers sent to the server.

timeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds for MCP requests.

trust.description: Marks the server as trusted. Trusted servers may gain additional capabilities.

includeTools.description: Subset of tools that should be enabled for this server. When omitted all tools are enabled.

excludeTools.description: Tools that should be disabled for this server even if exposed.

extension.description: Metadata describing the Gemini CLI extension that owns this MCP server.

oauth.description: OAuth configuration for authenticating with the server.

authProviderType.description: Authentication provider used for acquiring credentials (for example `dynamic_discovery`).

logPrompts.description: Whether prompts are logged in telemetry payloads.

outfile.description: File path for writing telemetry output.

useCollector.description: Whether to forward telemetry to an OTLP collector.

BugCommandSettings.description: Configuration for the bug report helper command.

urlTemplate.description: Template used to open a bug report URL. Variables in the template are populated at runtime.

SummarizeToolOutputSettings.description: Controls summarization behavior for individual tools. All properties are optional.

tokenBudget.description: Maximum number of tokens used when summarizing tool output.

CustomTheme.description: Custom theme definition used for styling Gemini CLI output. Colors are provided as hex strings or named ANSI colors.

ModelConfigAlias.description: An alias for a model configuration, potentially extending another alias.

extends.description: The name of another model config alias to extend.

modelConfig.description: The model configuration settings for this alias.

model.description: The base model name to use.

ModelConfigOverride.description: A specific override for model configuration based on matching criteria.

match.description: Criteria to match for applying this override.

model.description: A model name or alias to match.

overrideScope.description: An optional scope for the override (e.g., an agent name).

modelConfig.description: The model configuration to apply when matched.

model.description: The model name to override with.

temperature.description: The temperature for sampling. Between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.

topP.description: The top-P value for sampling. Between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.

candidateCount.description: The number of generated responses to return.

maxOutputTokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate.

HookDefinition.description: Defines a set of hooks for a specific event, optionally with a matcher.

matcher.description: An optional glob pattern to match against event-specific data (e.g., tool name).

sequential.description: If true, hooks will run sequentially, with output from one hook becoming input to the next.

hooks.description: An array of individual hook configurations.

HookConfig.description: Base configuration for a single hook.

type.description: The type of hook (e.g., 'command' for external scripts).

command.description: The command or script to execute.

PluginHookConfig.description: Configuration for a plugin hook (currently not detailed in provided code).
